p: According to Ayurveda, it is contraindicated to be used in a few diseases: Kushtha, Pandu, Mutrakriccha, Raktapitta; and in Grishma (summer) and Sharada (autumn) Ritu. There are few minor adverse effects recorded that did not need care, such as mild gastrointestinal symptoms, sleepiness, mild diarrhea during prior few days of treatment. It is also explained that ginger has the ability to induce heartburn and as a gastric irritant with doses above 6Â g [ 60]. During pregnancy, ginger did not pose a major risk for side effects or adverse events [ 61].
